Loading an external document (correct it yourself)

For the video, goto https://youtu.be/w1f1ictOSPA; the solution is here: https://youtu.be/-N5N865vft0

The XML source of the document is here: /declarative-amsterdam/xml/marsman.xml.

Check the Javascript console of your browser and prevent the message Synchronous XMLHttpRequest on the main thread is deprecated because of its detrimental effects to the end user's experience.

You will find the solution in the file load-doc-diy_.xslt.

Your solution should use the same <schedule-action>-instruction as before. But instead of the wait attribute, you will have to use the document. Its value should be the same URL as the one that you will pass to the doc() or document() function (for example, <ixsl:schedule-action document="{$external-doc}">). Since <schedule-action> only allows the call of a named template, you will have to define such a template yourself. That template should retrieve the document, put in into the HTML file by applying the TEI templates.
